I've watched FLCL.
I've enjoyed FLCL, even though I was confused as heck watching it with my friends. But being confused as heck was what made it so much fun to watch.

And then everything made sense in the end.
And there was much rejoicing.

topics.body:
DARNIT NICHIJOU

You have a gun-toting girl going crazy at stupid things and shooting people constantly, and nobody dies from gunfire or being blown up by a rocket launcher!

And I'm still not impressed or laughing!

-God this anime frustrates me-

topics.body:
"@igotnopicks":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55051db563687242811a0300#post_55051db563687242811a0300
[bq="igotnopicks"]"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55051cea6368721b9e530300#post_55051cea6368721b9e530300
I know a Ballet Anime shouldn't be so cool but *it* is.[/bq]
See that's where Tutu gets you. It's not actually a ballet anime. Yes it does use ballet as a focal point to it's story, but when you really think about it Princess Tutu's story is about the nature and power of stories.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@igotnopicks":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55051ba86368723e747d0200#post_55051ba86368723e747d0200
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55051cea6368721b9e530300#post_55051cea6368721b9e530300
Even though I still can't stop giggling at the title, I'm not sure if I'll like it. I'm actually pretty damn picky when it comes to anime, but if I watch it and like it, I'll stick around. And I hope the appeal can last as well. 

But now I feel bad for dropping Cute High Earth Defense Club Love! on such short notice. I guess the joke quickly overstayed its welcome. That and the "homo undertones" that made me feel both weird and dirty.

And the fact that I dropped it for Attack on Titan...which was WORTH IT.
